description.narrative: Building Resilient Communities, Wetland Ecosystems and Associated Catchments in Uganda

participating-org.narrative: UGA Min of Water and Env

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
Fund level Impact A1.0: Increased resilience and enhanced livelihoods of the most vulnerable people, communities and regions 1.2: Number (percentage) of households adopting a wider variety of livelihoods strategies/coping mechanisms 1.4: Area (ha) of agricultural land made more resilient to climate change through agricultural practices
Fund level Impact A4.0: Improved resilience of ecosystems and ecosystem services 4.1: Area(ha) of habitat or Kilometers of coastline rehabilitated, restored or protected 4.2: Area of agroforestry projects, forest- pastoral systems, or ecosystems -based adaptation systems established or enhanced
Project Outcomes: A7.0: Strengthened adaptive capacity and reduced exposure to climate risk 7.1: Use by vulnerable households, communities, businesses and public-sector services of Fund-supported tools, instruments, strategies and activities to respond to climate change and variability 7.2 Number of males and females reached by climate- related early warning systems and other risk reduction measures established/strengthened
Project Output 1: Restoration and management of wetland hydrology and associated catchment 1.1: Area (ha) of Wetland and natural grasslands rehabilitated 1.2: Surface area (Ha) restored, rehabilitated or enriched with grassed, herbaceous and wooded vegetation, reducing loss of topsoil, protecting riverbanks and improving infiltration in critical areas
Project Output 2: Improved agricultural practices and alternative livelihood options in the wetland catchment 2.1: Percentage change in agricultural incomes and alternative livelihoods in the project site 2.2: Number of women involved in livelihoods and employability interventions in the project sites
Project output 3: Strengthening access to climate and early warning information to farmers and other target communities 3.1: Percentage of population with access to improved climate information and drought, flood and severe storm warning (disaggregated gender) 3.2: Num

comment.narrative:
Baseline year: 2016
Fund level Impact A1.0: Increased resilience and enhanced livelihoods of the most vulnerable people, communities and regions 1.2: 150 Households with 52% of the household members being female adopted a wider variety of livelihood strategies/coping mechanisms 1.4: 30 ha of agricultural land made more resilient to climate change through agricultural practices
Fund level Impact A4.0: Improved resilience of ecosystems and ecosystem services 4.1: 483ha (South western), 141 ha (Eastern) of wetland restored. 5000ha of catchment restored 4.2: 2,000 ha of agroforestry projects, forest- pastoral systems, or ecosystems -based adaptation systems established or enhanced
Project Outcomes: A7.0 Strengthened adaptive capacity and reduced exposure to climate risk 7.1: 1000 Households with 52% of the members female use Fund-supported tools, instruments, strategies and activities 7.2: 1300 females and 1650 males reached by climate- related early warning systems and other risk reduction measures established/strengthened
Project Output 1: Restoration and management of wetland hydrology and associated catchment 1.1: 525Ha of Wetland and natural grasslands rehabilitated 1.2: 2000 ha of catchment restored, rehabilitated or enriched with grassed
Project Output 2: Improved agricultural practices and alternative livelihood options in the wetland catchment 2.1: 30% (100 Households) increase in agricultural incomes and alternative livelihoods in the project sites 2.2: 244 women involved in livelihoods and employability interventions in the project sites
Project output 3: Strengthening access to climate and early warning information to farmers and other target communities 3.1: 20% (of the total project area population around 3.9 million people) with access to improved climate information and drought, flood and severe storm warnings 3.2: 10 early flood warning systems installed in vulnerable communities.

Fund level Impact A1.0: Increased resilience and enhanced livelihoods of the most vulnerable people, communities and regions 1.2: 1000 Households adopt a wider variety of livelihoods strategies/coping mechanisms to respond to climate change and variability. 1.4: 500 (ha) of agricultural land made more resilient to climate change through agricultural practices.
Fund level Impact A4.0: Improved resilience of ecosystems and ecosystem services 4.1: 10,000 hectares of wetland restored or protected. 4.2: 2,326 ha of agroforestry projects, forest- pastoral systems, or ecosystems -based adaptation systems established or enhanced.
Project Outcomes: A7.0: Strengthened adaptive capacity and reduced exposure to climate risk 7.1: 400 Households use Fund-supported tools, instruments, strategies and activities to respond to climate change and variability. 7.2 10% males and females reached by climate- related early warning systems and other risk reduction measures established/strengthened.
Project Output 1: Restoration and management of wetland hydrology and associated catchment. 1.1: 10,000 ha of wetland and natural grasslands rehabilitated. 1.2. 500 Ha restored, rehabilitated or enriched with grassed, herbaceous and wooded vegetation, reducing loss of topsoil, protecting riverbanks and improving infiltration in critical areas
Project Output 2: Improved agricultural practices and alternative livelihood options in the wetland catchment.\ 2.1. 10 % change in agricultural incomes and alternative livelihoods in the project site 2.2: 500 women involved in livelihoods and employability interventions in the project sites.
Project output 3: Strengthening access to climate and early warning information to farmers and other target communities. 3.1. 15 % of population with access to improved climate information and drought, flood and severe storm warning (disaggregated gender) 3.2: 40 early flood warning systems (including 24 Automatic Weather Stations and 16 Automatic Water Level Stations installed in vulnerable communities

Fund level Impact A1.0: Increased resilience and enhanced livelihoods of the most vulnerable people, communities and regions. 1.2: 3624 (2600F, 1624M) Households adopting a wider variety of livelihoods strategies/coping mechanisms to respond to climate change and variability. 1.4. 04 (ha) of agricultural land made more resilient to climate change through agricultural practices.
Fund level Impact A4.0: Improved resilience of ecosystems and ecosystem services 4.1: 4000 ha of wetlands has resulted to increase in the wetland cover by 0.63% from the overall project target of 3% by 2025. 4.2. 00 ha of agroforestry projects, forest- pastoral systems, or ecosystems -based adaptation systems established or enhanced.
Project Outcomes: A7.0: Strengthened adaptive capacity and reduced exposure to climate risk. 7.1: 00 Households use Fund-supported tools, instruments, strategies and activities to respond to climate change and variability. 7.2. 38400 females and 57,600 males reached by climate- related early warning systems and other risk reduction measures established/strengthened.
Project Output 1: Restoration and management of wetland hydrology and associated catchment 1.1: 4,000 ha of wetland and natural grasslands rehabilitated. 1.2. 00 ha restored, rehabilitated or enriched with grass, herbaceous and wooded vegetation, reducing loss of topsoil, protecting riverbanks and improving infiltration in critical areas.
Project Output 2: Improved agricultural practices and alternative livelihood options in the wetland catchment – 2.1. 63 % change in agricultural incomes and alternative livelihoods in the project site in Pallisa from HH survey. 2.2: 3624 (2600F, 1624M) for both Eastern and south western Uganda) individuals have been reached by no regret interventions though a variety of livelihoods strategies/coping mechanisms to respond to climate change and variability.
Project output 3: Strengthening access to climate and early warning information to farmers and other target communities - 3.1. 12 % (96,000 beneficiaries-38400F and 57,600M) of population with access to improved climate information and drought, flood and severe storm warning (disaggregated gender) 3.2: 00 early flood warning systems (including 24 Automatic Weather Stations and 16 Automatic Water Level Stations installed in vulnerable communities).

Fund level Impact A1.0: Increased resilience and enhanced livelihoods of the most vulnerable people, communities and regions 1.2: 15500 Households with 52 % of the household members being female adopting a wider variety of livelihood strategies/coping mechanisms. 1.4: 4,000 (ha) of agricultural land made more resilient to climate change through agricultural practices
Fund level Impact A4.0: Improved resilience of ecosystems and ecosystem services 4.1: 10,000 ha (South western), 12,021 ha (Eastern) of wetland restored. 5500ha of catchment restored. 4.2: 5500ha of agroforestry projects, forest- pastoral systems, or ecosystems -based adaptation systems established or enhanced
Project Outcomes: A7.0: Strengthened adaptive capacity and reduced exposure to climate risk 7.1: 15,500 Households with 52% of the members female use Fund-supported tools, instruments, strategies and activities 7.2. 800,000 males and females reached by climate- related early warning systems and other risk reduction measures established/strengthened
Project Output 1: Restoration and management of wetland hydrology and associated catchment 1.1: 22,021 ha of wetland and natural grasslands rehabilitated 1.2: 5500 (Ha) restored, rehabilitated or enriched with grassed, herbaceous and wooded vegetation, reducing loss of topsoil, protecting riverbanks and improving infiltration in critical areas
Project Output 2: Improved agricultural practices and alternative livelihood options in the wetland catchment 2.1: 50% change in agricultural incomes and alternative livelihoods in the project site 2.2: 2,440 women involved in livelihoods and employability interventions in the project sites
Project output 3: Strengthening access to climate and early warning information to farmers and other target communities 3.1: 40% of population with access to improved climate information and drought, flood and severe storm warning (disaggregated gender) 3.2: 16 early flood warning systems installed in vulnerable communities

Fund level Impact A1.0: Increased resilience and enhanced livelihoods of the most vulnerable people, communities and regions 1.2: 15500 Households with 52 % of the household members being female adopting a wider variety of livelihood strategies/coping mechanisms. 1.4: 4,000 (ha) of agricultural land made more resilient to climate change through agricultural practices
Fund level Impact A4.0: Improved resilience of ecosystems and ecosystem services 4.1: 6,885ha (South Western) and 4,800ha (Eastern) of wetland was restored. 400ha of catchment area was restored. 4.2: 5500ha of agroforestry projects, forest- pastoral systems, or ecosystems -based adaptation systems established or enhanced
Project Outcomes: A7.0: Strengthened adaptive capacity and reduced exposure to climate risk 7.1: 15,500 Households with 52% of the members female use Fund-supported tools, instruments, strategies and activities 7.2. 5,000 males and females reached by climate- related early warning systems and other risk reduction measures established/strengthened

Project output 3: Strengthening access to climate and early warning information to farmers and other target communities 3.1: 50% of population with access to improved climate information and drought, flood and severe storm warning (disaggregated gender) 3.2: 16 early flood warning systems installed in vulnerable communities
